Platform.Title: UCSD, NimbleGen_E_coli_MG1655_371K Tiling_Array_2005
Platform.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: High-density DNA array prepared with Maskless Array Synthesizer (MAS) technology. See manufacturer's website at http://www.nimblegen.com/.
Platform.Description: NimbleGen design name 2005-04-20_Palsson_Ecoli_ChIP, NimbleGen design ID 1881. A tiling array design for Escherichia coli K12 MG1655 with 50-mer probe spaced 25bp apart across the genome. This design also contains control probes.

Column.Name: RANGE_STRAND
Column.Description: Strand (FWD + or REV - ) to which the indicated probe is directed; from the container field of ndf file.

Column.Name: RANGE_START
Column.Description: The genome coordinate of the left end of the indicated probe; from the position field of the ndf file.

Column.Name: RANGE_END
Column.Description: The genome coordinate of the right end of the indicated probe; from the position field of the ndf file.

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Link-Suffix: [gene name] AND Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655[organism]

Sample.Title: ec_logphase_1

Channel.Source: E. coli K12 MG1655, M9 complete medium, log phase
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655
Channel.Growth-Protocol: E. coli MG1655 strain was cultured in M9 complete medium at 37 °C with constant agitation and harvested at mid-exponential phase. (OD600nm ~ 0.6)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was extracted using the RNeasy Plus Mini kit (Qiagen Inc., Valencia, CA, USA) and the RNAprotect reagent (Qiagen) and DNA was removed by on-column DNase digestion with the RNase-Free DNase set (Qiagen). RNA quality and concentration was determined by analysis with an Thermo NanoDrop 1000.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeling was performed with an amino-allyl indirect labeling protocol followed by a Dnase I fragmentation step.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization was performed by UCSD GeneChip Core, following Nimblegen standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scan was performed with an Axon GenePix 4000B scanner by UCSD GeneChip Core, following Nimblegen standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Description: This sample is of wild-type E. coli MG1655 under mid-exponential condition. It is the first of three biological replicates used in this experiment, each from separate cultures.
Sample.Data-Processing: The raw data (.pair file) was subjected to quantile normalization (Bolstad et al. Bioinformatics 19(2):185), and background correction as implemented in the NimbleScan software package, version 2.4.27 (Roche NimbleGen, Inc.).

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log2 signal intensity of individual probes

Sample.Title: ec_heat_1

Channel.Source: E. coli K12 MG1655, M9 complete medium, log phase, heat shock 45 °C, 10 min
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655
Channel.Growth-Protocol: E. coli MG1655 strain was cultured in M9 complete medium at 37 °C with constant agitation. For heat-shock, culture was mix with pre-warmed medium (50 °C) and incubated at 45 °C for 10 min.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was extracted using the RNeasy Plus Mini kit (Qiagen Inc., Valencia, CA, USA) and the RNAprotect reagent (Qiagen) and DNA was removed by on-column DNase digestion with the RNase-Free DNase set (Qiagen). RNA quality and concentration was determined by analysis with an Thermo NanoDrop 1000.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeling was performed with an amino-allyl indirect labeling protocol followed by a Dnase I fragmentation step.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization was performed by UCSD GeneChip Core, following Nimblegen standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scan was performed with an Axon GenePix 4000B scanner by UCSD GeneChip Core, following Nimblegen standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Description: This sample is of wild-type E. coli MG1655 under heat-shocked condition. It is the first of three biological replicates used in this experiment, each from separate cultures.
Sample.Data-Processing: The raw data (.pair file) was subjected to quantile normalization (Bolstad et al. Bioinformatics 19(2):185), and background correction as implemented in the NimbleScan software package, version 2.4.27 (Roche NimbleGen, Inc.).

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log2 signal intensity of individual probes

Sample.Title: ec_nitrogen_1

Channel.Source: E. coli K12 MG1655, W2 minimal medium, log phase
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655
Channel.Growth-Protocol: E. coli MG1655 strain was cultured in W2 minimal medium (for nitrogen-limiting condition) at 37 °C with constant agitation and harvested at mid-exponential phase. (OD600nm ~ 0.6) (Powell, B. S. et al. J of Biol. Chem.270(9):4822)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was extracted using the RNeasy Plus Mini kit (Qiagen Inc., Valencia, CA, USA) and the RNAprotect reagent (Qiagen) and DNA was removed by on-column DNase digestion with the RNase-Free DNase set (Qiagen). RNA quality and concentration was determined by analysis with an Thermo NanoDrop 1000.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeling was performed with an amino-allyl indirect labeling protocol followed by a Dnase I fragmentation step.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization was performed by UCSD GeneChip Core, following Nimblegen standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scan was performed with an Axon GenePix 4000B scanner by UCSD GeneChip Core, following Nimblegen standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Description: This sample is of wild-type E. coli MG1655 under nitrogen-limiting condition. It is the first of three biological replicates used in this experiment, each from separate cultures.
Sample.Data-Processing: The raw data (.pair file) was subjected to quantile normalization (Bolstad et al. Bioinformatics 19(2):185), and background correction as implemented in the NimbleScan software package, version 2.4.27 (Roche NimbleGen, Inc.).

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log2 signal intensity of individual probes

Series.Title: Transcriptome analysis of E.coli MG1655 under multiple growth conditions
Series.Summary: Investigation of comprehensive information about the expression level of RNA transcripts across the entire E.coli genome in mulitple growth conditions, including log-phase; stationary phase, heat shock and nitrogen-limiting condition.
Series.Overall-Design: A fourteen chip study using total RNA recovered from four separate culture conditions of E.coli K12 MG1655. E.coli strains were harvested at mid-exponential phase with exception of stationary phase experiments. The high-density oligonucleotide tiling arrays used were consisted of 371,034 oligonucleotide probes spaced 25 bp apart (25-bp overlap between two probes) across the E. coli genome (NimbleGen). Experiments were conducted as three or more biological replicates (different cultures)
Series.Type: Expression profiling by genome tiling array
